citations.narrative:
* At the exotic animal auction in Columbus, Ne., on the 20-September-2025, you had two Coati Mundis consigned in the
auction that were housed in a medium taxi carrier. This taxi carrier had a metal round feed receptacle. This receptacles'
metal surface was excessively rusty and corroding. As result of this excessive corroded rusty surface, indicates adequate
measures are not being taken to minimize contamination and deterioration of food. Therefore this can increase the
disease hazards for the two animals.
For the prevention of diseases and contaminated food, adequate measures must be taken for feed receptacles to be free
of corrosion that prevents proper cleaning and sanitization.
To be corrected by, 07-October-2025.

* At the exotic animal auction in Columbus, Ne., on the 20th of September, there was two Coati Mundis housed in a
medium taxi carrier you had consigned at the sale. This taxi carrier had an excessively rusty and corroded round metal
water receptacle. The excessively corroded surface prevents the receptacle for being properly cleaned and sanitized,
therefore increasing the disease hazards and minimizing the health for the two animals.
For the health and the prevention of disease hazards, all watering receptacles must be maintained and or free of
corrosion that prevents cleaning and sanitation.
To be corrected by, 07-October-2025.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live animals.
citations.narrative:
* At the exotic animal auction on the 20-September-2025, in Columbus, Ne., you had consigned four rabbits, two coati
mundis, one red kangaroo and two love birds. None of the primary enclosures used to transport these animals were
marked on top and on one or more sides with the words "Live Animals" and or "wild Animals" in letters not less than (1
inch) in height and with arrows identifying the correct upright position. Without these markings on the primary transport
enclosures this can allow for the animals to be mishandled while in transport during movements, Therefore potentially
effecting the health and well-being of the animals.
All transport enclosures must be clearly marked with either "Live Animals" and or "Wild Animals" on the top and one or
more sides with letters at least (1 inch) in height, and with arrows pointing in the upright position. This will prevent
improper handling of the animals in transport and ensure their health and well-being.
To be corrected by, 07-October-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.129(b) 
   
Feeding. 
* At the exotic animal auction in Columbus, Ne., on the 20-September-2025, you had two Coati Mundis consigned in the 
auction that were housed in a medium taxi carrier. This taxi carrier had a metal round feed receptacle. This receptacles' 
metal surface was excessively rusty and corroding. As result of this excessive corroded rusty surface, indicates adequate 
measures are not being taken to minimize contamination and deterioration of food. Therefore this can increase the 
disease hazards for the two animals.  
 
For the prevention of diseases and contaminated food, adequate measures must be taken for feed receptacles to be free 
of corrosion that prevents proper cleaning and sanitization.  
 
To be corrected by, 07-October-2025. 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
* At the exotic animal auction in Columbus, Ne., on the 20th of September, there was two Coati Mundis housed in a 
medium taxi carrier you had consigned at the sale. This taxi carrier had an excessively rusty and corroded round metal 
water receptacle. The excessively corroded surface prevents the receptacle for being properly cleaned and sanitized, 
therefore increasing the disease hazards and minimizing the health for the two animals.  
 
For the health and the prevention of disease hazards, all watering receptacles must be maintained and or free of 
corrosion that prevents cleaning and sanitation.  
 
To be corrected by, 07-October-2025. 
3.137(e) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live animals. 
* At the exotic animal auction on the 20-September-2025, in Columbus, Ne., you had consigned four rabbits, two coati 
mundis, one red kangaroo and two love birds. None of the primary enclosures used to transport these animals were 
marked on top and on one or more sides with the words "Live Animals" and or "wild Animals" in letters not less than (1

inch) in height and with arrows identifying the correct upright position. Without these markings on the primary transport 
enclosures this can allow for the animals to be mishandled while in transport during movements, Therefore potentially 
effecting the health and well-being of the animals.  
 
All transport enclosures must be clearly marked with either "Live Animals" and or "Wild Animals" on the top and one or 
more sides with letters at least (1 inch) in height, and with arrows pointing in the upright position. This will prevent 
improper handling of the animals in transport and ensure their health and well-being.  
 
To be corrected by, 07-October-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
